name: Diegetic Leaderboard and Online High-Score System
oneLiner: Implemented a fully online, diegetic leaderboard system in Unreal Engine 5 that computes player scores from gameplay results, communicates with a REST API, and triggers dynamic procedural audio commentary for top-ranking entries.
bulletpoints: Designed a diegetic in-world leaderboard UI that displays online high scores without breaking player immersion.
Computed player scores from multiple gameplay metrics including coins collected, stars earned, remaining lives, and completion time.
Integrated REST API communication to submit and retrieve scores, enabling persistent online leaderboards and dynamic rank updates.

captions.frogger-game-highscore__01__diegetic-lea: Diegetic leaderboard screen integrated into the game world before any scores are retrieved.
captions.frogger-game-highscore__02__diegetic-lea: Leaderboard populated with online scores fetched from a REST API, displaying rank, score breakdown, remaining lives, and completion time.

deepDive.problem: Validating a complete game experience required more than local scoring; the project needed a persistent, online leaderboard that reflected player performance accurately and enhanced the sense of progression and competition.
approach: Defined a structured scoring model that aggregates multiple gameplay metrics (coins, stars, remaining lives, and completion time) into a final score.
Serialized gameplay results into a JSON payload including player name and selected avatar, and transmitted it via REST API calls to a backend service.
Fetched and displayed ranked score data in a diegetic in-world leaderboard UI to maintain immersion.
Triggered procedurally generated audio commentary when player scores entered top-ranking positions, reinforcing achievement through dynamic feedback.
